The OS is a simply a pleasure to use, which in turn gives application developers a solid foundation to build on.

In this regard, Windows simply does not stack up. Windows is an endlessly configurable mess of options that sells through every darn channel possible. To design and develop on Windows machines is to work in the most adverse environment first. ‚Äì Jon Tan

For reasons like these, I keep Windows close throughout my process. It has positive side effects in my everyday workflow, even if I‚Äôm developing on a Mac. I design and code defensively.
